title: Data Loss Prevention Provider GTB Technologies Supports Breast Cancer Awareness Month
text:
Gartner Visionary, GTB Technologies, Inc. the leading independent Data Loss Prevention, Cloud Visibility & DLP / APT Company ( www.gtbtechnologies.com ) is pleased to announce that requests for license donations of its award winning HIPAA Data Discovery and Data Classification program are now being taken.
With October being breast cancer awareness month, GTB Technologies, Inc. will be joining in the efforts by opening up its Leslie Cohen Tully Data Discovery Donation Program to donation requests for data discovery licenses.
The GTB Donation program is in memory of Leslie Cohen Tully, the sister of one of GTB Technologies founders. Leslie was diagnosed with Stage II cancer in the spring of 2002, who unfortunately, after a brutal fight, succumbed to the disease March 8, 2006; just a few days shy of her 48th birthday.
“Our donations are aimed to help nonprofit cancer organizations and research centers avoid heavy fines and damaging publicity while achieving compliance and maintaining patient privacy. During the month of October we will be providing free GTB Discovery licenses to nonprofits with the hope that the savings of license fees will provide these organizations funds which can be spent on research and patient care " says Wendy Cohen, Discovery Donation Program Organizer and GTB Co-Founder.
The GTB HIPAA Data at Rest Scanner is a Data Discovery tool that searches an enterprise network for HIPAA violations including PHI and PII data. The system runs over the network and does not require an agent. It searches any file format on Windows and UNIX file-Shares and reports the files location, the file owner, the actual violating data along with other metadata. Donations include support and future maintenance upgrades.
Requests for a donation may be by contacting GTB Technologies
About GTB Technologies, Inc.:
GTB Technologies Cybersecurity and DLP solutions enable its customers to allow the flowing of ideas and collaboration from within the enterprise, through the cloud and social media; with the comfort that their sensitive, confidential data remains just that … Confidential.
GTB’s Cybersecurity solutions provide enterprises the ability to analyze and control data from a myriad of sources— laptops, database exchanges, cloud services, such as Amazon AWS, Amazon Cloud, Box, Dropbox, Evernote, Google Cloud, Google Docs, Google Drive, Office 365, OneDrive, Salesforce, SAP and more, to Shadow IT (BYOx), email, instant messengers, social media, websites and even malware or cyber espionage insiders “phoning home” data, such as in the recent Sony and Anthem data breaches. On-premise, off-premise via the GTB Cloud, Managed Security Program or Hybrid MSP Deployment modes are available.
